column4: I just installed Ubuntu Server 8.10. Port forwarding is set up correctly on my router, but I can't connect to my computer at that port over the internet. I've installed moblock but even with moblock disabled, nothing can see my forwarded port. Is there anything else that could be blocking connections to that porT?
check if the forwarded packets arrive at your ubuntu pc with tcpdump
I tried tcpdump port xxxx and it shows that the connection is getting through. any idea why it's still getting blocked?

when I test other ports from utorrent.com/testport.php?port=xxxx they show up as open, just not ports that i've recently opened it seems, although they are allowed through by my router. do I need to configure this manually or something?
are you sure the port forwarding on your router works? do you use upnp?

I don't use upnp. the port forwarding on my router seems to work fine, I test other ports and they show up as ok. but I just added a couple new rules to test it, and they get through to my linux box but the port checker still says that it's closed
is that port listening on your linux box?
check with netstat -plutn
yes it is listening
is your routing ok?
how can I be sure my routing is ok?
does your box have multiple ips? is the default route set?
my box only has one ip, how do I check if the default route is set?
route -n
look for an entry with destination 0.0.0.0 and genmask 0.0.0.0
looks ok
yes
then the app listening on that port doesn't responde
if its tcp you can check with telnet ip port
ok I'll try that out, thanks for all your help
np
